lines.text:
[January contemplates renting her own apartment]
I wouldn't ask Mike for the money. I have none of my own.
You'll work for Linda Riggs and Gloss magazine. With the circles you're traveling in, honey, you're an asset.

writing, screwing, everything! Do you know what a man said to me last night? He said, "Linda, you have a ten fingers like a mouth and a mouth like ten fingers!" Now, you couldn't ask for a better reference than that, could you?
Incidentally, Dee, the leading men in my pictures would say to me, "You are so beautiful when you are angry!"
[approaches Dee to embrace her from behind]
I'm sorry I can't say the same for you.
Listen, if you don't appreciate rock, I've got plenty of others. Mood stuff.
How's this? "Music To Get It Up By".
I don't intend to die. There's no future in it.
I didn't know men used hairspray.

[talking about January's feelings for her father]
I've always had a hunch I was just a replacement.
I hate to end our little talk on a note of slight but unquestionable vulgarity, but I do have to pee.
